intro: Cyrtandra exserta, commonly known as the Hawaiian red ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Cyrtandra exserta thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories on the islands of Oahu and Maui. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in Hawaiian flora.
